description:
Vincent Vega Plays Tarintino, A night of surf, soul and rockn'roll bangers from Quentin Tarantino's cult classic films, played with great vengeance & furious anger by Wellingtons favourite surf-rock saviours Vincent Vega. Expect tunes from Pulp Fiction, Reservoir Dogs, Once Upon A Time In Hollywood, The Hateful Eight, Death Proof and more.

Featuring special guests Lisa Tomlins on vocals and Louis TM on keys and vocals, as well as the usual suspects in Richard Te One (drums), Nick Lissette (bass) and Chris Armour (guitar)

Music from 9:30pm FREE ENTRY
label: Music & Concerts

description:
'TONES OF SILENCE' - FUTUNA CHAPEL IN B&W - EXHIBITION, ‘TONES of SILENCE’ – FUTUNA CHAPEL in BLACK & WHITE - EXHIBITION
The ‘Tones of Silence’ -explored through B & W photography taken with vintage camera and lenses to give another way of viewing and experiencing the Chapel. This exhibition will explore the tones, textures, composition and forms of the Chapel in black and white with many shades of grey.
"Generally, the older the equipment, the greater the personal input of the photographer is required and therefore the greater the commitment and individuality. Often, you can look at a 19th-century photograph and tell who the photographer is. You certainly can't do that today. It isn't only the camera and lens, but also the type of film (or in those days, glass plate), the developer used and how the print is made onto particular types of paper. Each gives a distinct interpretation".
John Grace - email - 18/06/25
The Trust looks forward to welcoming architects, designers, graduates, students and interested members of the public to attend this event and support the Trust in its work.
The Futuna Trust is a charitable organisation and all koha received from the exhibition events will go towards the ongoing care, maintenance and operation of Futuna Chapel and also to support various initiatives undertaken by the Trust.  Please register
BOOKINGS ARE PREFERRED TO ATTEND THIS EVENT
label: Arts & Theatre

description: Financial Foundations: Budgeting for New Business Owners, A practical workshop on financial management and budgeting for new business owners. Learn how to set up financial systems, use accounting software, and create a budget that ensures your business stays on a healthy financial track from the very beginning.
label: Business & Networking

description: Business Budgeting Workshop: Spreadsheets & Financial Tracking, A practical workshop on using spreadsheets for business budgeting and financial tracking. Learn how to create a simple budget, forecast revenue and expenses, and monitor your business's financial health with confidence.
label: Classes & Workshops

description: The Great Wairarapa Dog Show, A light-hearted dog show competition open to all breeds and ages, with categories including 'Best Trick', 'Waggiest Tail', and 'Cutest Costume'. A fun family event with prizes and local pet-focused stalls. This is a new take on a dog show and is located in the Wairarapa.
label: Community & Culture

description: Eco-Friendly Cleaning Workshop: DIY Household Cleaners, A hands-on workshop on making your own eco-friendly household cleaners. Learn simple recipes for natural, non-toxic cleaners using everyday ingredients like vinegar, baking soda, and essential oils. All materials included.
label: Conservation & Environment

description: Community Garden Build Day: From Plot to Harvest, A community event for building and planting a new community garden. Join your neighbors to prepare the soil, build raised beds, and plant a variety of vegetables and herbs. This is a great way to meet people and get involved in local food systems.
label: Conservation & Environment

description: History of Wellington's Parks: A Guided Walk, A guided walk on the history of Wellington's parks and reserves. Learn about the history of a specific local park, from its origins as a public space to its current role in conservation and recreation.
label: Conservation & Environment

description: Sustainable Wardrobe Workshop: Thrifting & Planning, A workshop on creating a sustainable wardrobe through thrifting and capsule planning. Learn how to shop for secondhand clothing, repair and upcycle garments, and build a timeless wardrobe that is both stylish and eco-friendly.
label: Conservation & Environment

description: Pollinator Seminar: Bees & Our Ecosystem, A seminar on the role of bees and other pollinators in our ecosystem. Hear from a beekeeper and a botanist on the importance of pollinators for food production and biodiversity, and what you can do to create a pollinator-friendly garden.
label: Conservation & Environment

description: Native Tree Identification: A Guided Walk, A guided walk focusing on identifying native trees and their uses. Learn about the different types of native trees, their cultural significance, and their role in the ecosystem. This is a great way to deepen your knowledge of New Zealand's unique flora.
label: Conservation & Environment

description: Zero-Waste Bathroom Workshop: DIY Products, A hands-on workshop on creating a 'zero-waste' bathroom with DIY products. Learn to make your own toothpaste, deodorant, and other personal care products, reducing plastic waste and exposure to harsh chemicals.
label: Conservation & Environment

description: Community Conservation Campaign: A Call to Action, A community-led campaign for a local conservation issue. This event brings together residents, activists, and experts to discuss a specific conservation issue and organize a campaign to address it. This is a great way to get involved in local democracy.
label: Conservation & Environment

description: Freshwater Talk: Protecting Our Local Streams, A talk on the importance of fresh water and how to protect local streams and rivers. Hear from a freshwater ecologist on the threats to our waterways and what we can do to improve their health and biodiversity.

description: Seed Saving Workshop: Heritage Gardening, A workshop on basic seed saving and heritage gardening. Learn how to save seeds from your own plants, store them properly, and grow a variety of heritage vegetables and herbs to preserve genetic diversity and build a resilient food system.

description: Butterfly Garden Workshop: Planting for Pollinators, A hands-on workshop for building and planting a butterfly garden. Learn how to select plants that attract butterflies and other pollinators, and how to create a habitat that supports a healthy and diverse ecosystem in your backyard.
label: Conservation & Environment

description: Plastic Packaging Seminar: Alternatives & Impacts, A seminar on the impact of plastic packaging on the environment and alternatives. Hear from experts on the latest innovations in sustainable packaging and what you can do as a consumer to reduce your plastic footprint.

description: Upcycling Workshop: Old Clothes into New Bags, A workshop on upcycling old clothes into new garments or bags. Learn basic sewing and design techniques to transform old clothing into new, stylish, and functional items, reducing textile waste and promoting sustainable fashion.

description: River Restoration Day: Community Planting, A community river restoration day. Join your neighbors to plant native trees and shrubs along a local riverbank, helping to stabilize the soil, improve water quality, and create a healthier ecosystem for native fish and birds.

description: Wellington Port History: Environmental Legacy Talk, A talk on the history of Wellington's port and its environmental legacy. Learn about the port's industrial past, the environmental challenges it has faced, and the ongoing efforts to clean up the harbor and restore its health.

description: Organic Fertilizer Workshop: Compost Teas & More, A hands-on workshop on making your own organic fertilizer and compost teas. Learn simple recipes for nutrient-rich fertilizers that will nourish your plants and improve the health of your soil without the use of harsh chemicals.

description: Renewable Energy Seminar: The Latest in Green Tech, A seminar on the latest in renewable energy technologies. Hear from experts on solar, wind, and geothermal power, and the role of these technologies in the transition to a low-carbon economy.

description: DIY Greenhouse Workshop: Building with Recycled Materials, A hands-on workshop on building a home greenhouse from recycled materials. Learn how to design and construct a simple, affordable greenhouse to extend your growing season and protect your plants from the elements.
label: Conservation & Environment

description: Community Tree Planting: A Reforestation Event, A community event for a large-scale tree-planting project. Join your neighbors to plant thousands of native trees, helping to reforest a local reserve and create a healthier, more biodiverse environment for future generations.
label: Conservation & Environment

description: Climate Change for Kids: A Fun Science Talk, A talk on the science of climate change, specifically for children. Using fun and engaging experiments, this talk helps kids understand the causes and effects of climate change and what they can do to help protect the planet.
label: Conservation & Environment

description: Organic Pest Management Workshop: Natural Solutions, A hands-on workshop on identifying and managing garden pests without chemicals. Learn about organic pest control methods and how to create a healthy garden ecosystem that naturally repels pests.
label: Conservation & Environment

description: Guided History Walk: A Local Forest or Park, A guided walk on the history of a specific local forest or park. Learn about the land's past, from its use by early Māori to its current role as a public space and conservation area. This is a great way to connect with your local environment.

description: Sustainable Tourism Seminar: Business Opportunities, A seminar on the business opportunities in sustainable tourism. description: Natural Candles Workshop: From Beeswax to Soy, A hands-on workshop on making natural candles from beeswax or soy wax. Learn how to melt wax, add essential oils, and pour your own custom candles to create a beautiful and eco-friendly gift or home decoration.

description: Wellington's Marine Reserve: A Biodiversity Talk, A talk on Wellington's marine reserve and its biodiversity. label: Conservation & Environment

description: Predator-Free Wellington Campaign: A Community Briefing, A community-led campaign for a predator-free neighborhood. label: Conservation & Environment

description: Insect Macro Photography Workshop: A Tiny World, A hands-on workshop on the art of insect macro photography. description: Pollinator Garden Workshop: A Buzz for Urban Spaces, A workshop on creating a pollinator-friendly garden in an urban setting. description: Wellington's Native Forests: A Regeneration Talk, A talk on the history of Wellington's native forests and their regeneration. Learn about the challenges these forests have faced over the years, the conservation efforts that have been made, and the unique species that call them home.

description: Natural Pest Control: A Companion Planting Workshop, A workshop on natural pest control for home gardens using companion planting. Learn which plants to grow together to deter pests, attract beneficial insects, and create a healthy and chemical-free garden ecosystem.
label: Conservation & Environment

description: Stream Clean-Up & Water Testing Day, A community clean-up of a specific stream or river, with a focus on water quality testing. Join volunteers to remove litter from the waterway and learn how to use simple testing kits to monitor its health.

description: Eco-Friendly Crafts: Wrapping Paper & Cards Workshop, A hands-on workshop on creating eco-friendly wrapping paper and cards using natural dyes, recycled paper, and other sustainable materials. Learn how to make beautiful, personalized gifts that are kind to the environment.

description: Bird-Watching Walk: A Guided Tour of Zealandia, A guided bird-watching walk at a local reserve. Learn how to identify native birds by their calls and songs, and discover the unique species that call the reserve home. This is a great way to connect with your local environment.

description: Citizen Science in Bird Tracking: A Talk, A talk on the role of citizen science in tracking bird populations. Learn how you can contribute to bird research by collecting data on native birds in your backyard and community, helping scientists monitor their health and well-being.

description: DIY Household Cleaners Workshop: Laundry & Dish Soap, A hands-on workshop on making your own eco-friendly household laundry and dish soap. Learn simple recipes for natural, non-toxic cleaners using everyday ingredients, reducing plastic waste and exposure to harsh chemicals.

description: Community Garden Open Day: Share & Learn, A community garden 'open day' where members show off their plots and share knowledge. This is a great way to meet other gardeners, get inspired, and learn about the joys of growing your own food in a community setting.

description: Marine Reserves Seminar: Fish Breeding & Biodiversity, A seminar on the importance of marine reserves for fish breeding and biodiversity. description: Low-Carbon Economy: A Business Transition Seminar, A seminar on the role of businesses in transitioning to a low-carbon economy. description: Community Hero Card Workshop: A Creative Gift, A workshop on creating personalized greeting cards for a local hero or community member. Kids will learn different craft techniques, from paper cutting to collage, to create a unique and heartfelt card for a local hero in their community.

description: Wellington Meditation Festival: A Wellness Event, A festival of wellness, with a focus on a specific practice, e.g., meditation. description: Fantasy Film Festival: 'Pan's Labyrinth', A screening of Guillermo del Toro's dark fantasy film 'Pan's Labyrinth' at the BATS Theatre. label: Film & Media

description: Dessert Degustation, An evening of pure indulgence. Our pastry chef has created a multi-course dessert degustation, with each dish a work of art. From rich chocolate mousses to delicate fruit tarts and innovative ice creams, this is a sweet feast for the eyes and the palate. Wine and cocktail pairings are also available.
label: Food & Drink

description: Public Sector Innovation Showcase: A conference highlighting new technologies and innovative projects being developed within the government sector to improve public services and efficiency.
label: Government & Politics

description: Wellington Regional Council's Transport Masterplan: A public consultation on the long-term vision for transport in the Wellington region, including new roads, cycleways, and train lines.
label: Government & Politics

description: Democracy in a Digital Age: A panel on the challenges and opportunities of modern democracy, including the impact of social media, online misinformation, and digital voting systems.
label: Government & Politics

description: The Role of Local Government in the Arts: A forum with city officials, artists, and arts organisations to discuss public funding, policy, and support for Wellington's vibrant arts and culture sector.
label: Government & Politics

description: Civic Leaders Youth Mentorship Program: An initiative connecting young people with current and former politicians, public servants, and community leaders to encourage future civic participation.
label: Government & Politics

description: Men's Wellbeing Workshop: Responding to Change, A workshop for men to develop tools for navigating life changes, big and small. Topics include career transitions, relationship challenges, and new parenthood. The session is led by a male wellness coach and focuses on open discussion and practical strategies for a healthy mindset.
label: Health & Wellness

description: Wellington Writers Group: Short Story Workshop, Join the Wellington Writers Group for a special short story writing workshop. Our guest instructor, a published author, will guide you through the process of writing a short story, from brainstorming and outlining to revision and editing. This is a great opportunity to get some expert guidance on your writing project and connect with other writers. Limited spaces, so book early!.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description: Wellington Local Makers Fair, The Wellington Local Makers Fair is a vibrant showcase of handcrafted goods, bringing together a diverse group of artisans from across the city. You'll find unique items including custom jewelry, intricate pottery, and beautiful textiles. This event is a great way to meet the creators behind the products and support small businesses in your community. Enjoy a bustling atmosphere with live music and delicious food stalls while you shop.
label: Markets & Fairs

description: Christian Meditation Workshop, A workshop introducing the practice of Christian meditation. Learn how to use silent contemplation, Lectio Divina (divine reading), and centering prayer to deepen your relationship with God. This is a practical and prayerful session for anyone wanting to quiet their mind and listen for God's voice. No prior experience is needed.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Spiritual Gifts Workshop, A workshop designed to help you discover and develop your spiritual gifts. Through a series of self-assessments, talks, and group activities, you will learn what your unique gifts are and how to use them to serve God and others. This is an empowering and encouraging session for all believers.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Theology on Tap: St. Thomas Aquinas, A monthly gathering at a local pub for an informal discussion on faith, theology, and their intersection with modern culture. This month, we'll be discussing the life and work of St. Thomas Aquinas. All are welcome to attend, ask questions, and share their perspectives. Snacks and drinks will be provided.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Youth Ministry Games Night, A monthly gathering for high school students to have fun and connect with other teenagers in our youth ministry. We'll have board games, card games, and video games, as well as plenty of snacks and drinks. This is a great opportunity to make new friends and build community in a relaxed and friendly environment.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Sunday School for All Ages, We offer Sunday School classes for all ages, from toddlers to adults. Our classes are designed to be interactive, engaging, and relevant to your life. Children will learn about the Bible through stories, songs, and crafts, while adults will engage in in-depth discussion and study. All are welcome to attend and grow in their faith.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Latter-day Saint General Conference, A semi-annual broadcast of the General Conference of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints. Listen to inspiring messages from the prophet and other church leaders, and be uplifted by beautiful music from the Tabernacle Choir. This is a great opportunity to hear messages of hope and faith from around the world. All are welcome to attend the broadcast.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Interfaith Panel on the Afterlife, A panel discussion on the concept of the afterlife from the perspective of different religious traditions. Our guest panel will feature representatives from Christianity, Islam, Buddhism, and Hinduism. This is a unique opportunity to learn about the diverse beliefs and teachings on what happens after death. All are welcome to attend and ask questions.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Spiritual Film Night: 'The Two Popes', A screening and discussion of the film 'The Two Popes'. This film explores the relationship between Pope Benedict XVI and the future Pope Francis, and the challenges facing the Catholic Church. Following the film, there will be an open discussion to share thoughts and reflections. Snacks and drinks will be provided.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Christianity 101: An Introduction to the Faith, A free, six-week course that provides an introduction to the Christian faith. This course will cover the basics of Christianity, from the life of Jesus to the meaning of the cross and resurrection. This is a great way to explore the faith in a relaxed and non-judgmental environment. All are welcome to attend and ask questions.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Community Service Day: Serving Our City, A day of service where we come together to serve our community. Projects will include cleaning up local parks, helping at a local food bank, and visiting a nursing home. This is a great opportunity to live out our faith and make a tangible difference in the world. All are welcome to join us.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Exploring The Book of Exodus, A weekly Bible study of the Book of Exodus. We will explore the story of Moses, the plagues of Egypt, and the journey of the Israelites to the promised land. This is a great opportunity to learn about the historical and spiritual significance of this foundational book of the Bible. All are welcome to attend.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Interfaith Potluck and Fellowship, Join us for an evening of food, fellowship, and interfaith dialogue. Bring a dish to share that represents your faith or culture, and enjoy a meal with people from different backgrounds. This is a great opportunity to make new friends, learn about different traditions, and build a more inclusive community. All are welcome.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Men's Ministry Hike and Campout, A weekend hike and campout for men of all ages. We will hike a local trail, set up camp, and enjoy a time of fellowship and spiritual reflection around the campfire. This is a great opportunity to connect with other men in the ministry and enjoy the beauty of God's creation. All men are welcome to attend.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Spiritual Writing Workshop, A workshop for those interested in using writing as a spiritual practice. Learn how to use journaling, poetry, and creative writing to deepen your relationship with God and your inner self. This is a safe and supportive space to explore your creativity and your faith. No prior experience is needed.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Youth Group: Worship Night and Bonfire, A special evening of worship and fellowship for high school students. We will have a time of praise and worship music, followed by a bonfire with s'mores and hot chocolate. This is a great opportunity to connect with God and with friends in a fun and relaxed environment. All teenagers are welcome.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Women's Ministry Craft Night, A fun and creative evening for women of all ages. We will be making a simple craft project while enjoying a time of fellowship and conversation. This is a great opportunity to connect with other women in the ministry and have a relaxing night out. All materials will be provided, and no prior experience is needed.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Christian Apologetics Seminar, A seminar on Christian apologetics, the practice of defending the Christian faith with reason and evidence. This session will cover common objections to Christianity and provide tools for engaging in respectful and thoughtful conversation. This is a great opportunity to strengthen your faith and learn how to share it with others. All are welcome.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Spiritual Film Night: 'Into Great Silence', A screening and discussion of the film 'Into Great Silence'. This documentary provides a rare look into the lives of Carthusian monks in the French Alps. Following the film, there will be an open discussion to share thoughts and reflections. Snacks and drinks will be provided.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Spiritual Book Club: 'The Untethered Soul', Join our monthly spiritual book club as we discuss Michael A. Singer's 'The Untethered Soul'. This book explores the nature of consciousness and how to live a life of freedom and joy. This is a great opportunity to connect with other readers and share your personal insights in a relaxed, conversational setting.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Exploring Catholicism: A Q&A Session, A public Q&A session on the Catholic faith. This is a great opportunity to ask any questions you have about the Catholic Church, from its history and theology to its practices and traditions. A panel of priests and lay leaders will be on hand to answer your questions in a respectful and open environment. All are welcome.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Spiritual Journey to Israel, An informational evening about an upcoming pilgrimage to the Holy Land. Learn about the itinerary, historical sites, and spiritual significance of visiting Israel. This is a chance to ask questions, meet fellow travelers, and prepare for a life-changing journey of faith and discovery.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Christian Yoga: A Devotional Practice, A weekly yoga class that combines physical postures with Christian devotional practices. This session is designed to help you connect with God through movement and prayer. All skill levels are welcome, and no prior yoga experience is needed. Please bring a yoga mat and a water bottle.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: The Holy Rosary: A Prayerful Walk, A prayerful walk of the Rosary through our local community. We will walk in a group, praying the Rosary and meditating on the mysteries of the life of Christ. This is a great opportunity to get some exercise, spend time in prayer, and witness to your faith in the community. All are welcome to join us.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Interfaith Panel on Social Justice, A panel discussion on the role of faith in social justice. Our guest panel will feature representatives from different religious traditions who are actively working for social change in our community. This is a great opportunity to learn about the different ways faith can inspire action and create a more just world. All are welcome to attend and ask questions.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Youth Group Movie Night: 'The Case for Christ', A movie night for high school students featuring the film 'The Case for Christ'. This film tells the true story of an investigative journalist who sets out to disprove Christianity but instead finds faith. This is a great opportunity to watch a thought-provoking film and discuss questions about faith and evidence. Pizza and popcorn will be provided.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Women's Ministry Retreat: Finding Your Purpose, A weekend retreat for women to connect with each other and with God. Through talks, small group discussions, and personal reflection time, we will explore what it means to find our purpose and live a life of faith. This is a great opportunity to get away from distractions and be refreshed in your spirit. All women are welcome to attend.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Christianity and Science Discussion Group, A monthly discussion group exploring the relationship between Christianity and science. We will delve into topics such as evolution, cosmology, and neuroscience, and discuss how faith and reason can coexist. This is a great opportunity to engage in thoughtful conversation and learn from others. All are welcome to attend.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Spiritual Film Night: 'The Shack', A screening and discussion of the film 'The Shack'. This film explores the nature of God and the meaning of suffering through the story of a man who encounters the Trinity in a shack in the wilderness. Following the film, there will be an open discussion to share thoughts and reflections. Snacks and drinks will be provided.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Spiritual Book Club: 'The Four Agreements', Join our monthly spiritual book club as we discuss Don Miguel Ruiz's 'The Four Agreements'. This book explores the power of personal beliefs and how to live a life of freedom and joy. This is a great opportunity to connect with other readers and share your personal insights in a relaxed, conversational setting.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Exploring Anglicanism: A Tour and Talk, A guided tour and talk on the history and traditions of Anglicanism. We will explore the architecture of our beautiful church, discuss the unique aspects of Anglican worship, and learn about the church's role in the community. This is a great opportunity for anyone curious about Anglicanism. All are welcome.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Spiritual Journey to Rome, An informational evening about an upcoming pilgrimage to Rome and the Vatican. Learn about the itinerary, historical sites, and spiritual significance of visiting the heart of the Catholic Church. This is a chance to ask questions, meet fellow travelers, and prepare for a life-changing journey of faith and discovery.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Christian Tai Chi: A Meditative Practice, A weekly Tai Chi class that combines gentle movements with Christian devotional practices. This session is designed to help you connect with God through movement and prayer. All skill levels are welcome, and no prior Tai Chi experience is needed. Please wear comfortable clothing.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: The Holy Rosary: A Family Workshop, A family-friendly workshop on the Holy Rosary. Learn how to pray the Rosary together as a family, and make your own Rosary beads. This is a great opportunity to introduce your children to this beautiful and powerful prayer tradition. All materials will be provided, and no prior experience is needed.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Interfaith Panel on Prayer, A panel discussion on the practice of prayer from the perspective of different religious traditions. Our guest panel will feature representatives from Christianity, Islam, and Judaism. This is a great opportunity to learn about the diverse ways people connect with God and to share your own experiences. All are welcome to attend and ask questions.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Youth Group Worship Night, A special evening of worship and fellowship for high school students. We will have a time of praise and worship music, followed by a short devotional and small group discussions. This is a great opportunity to connect with God and with friends in a fun and relaxed environment. All teenagers are welcome.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Women's Ministry Retreat: A Weekend of Rest, A weekend retreat for women to get away from the demands of daily life and find rest in God's presence. Through guided meditations, personal reflection, and group sessions, we will focus on finding peace and renewal. All women are welcome to attend this restorative experience.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Spiritual Journaling for Inner Peace, A hands-on workshop on the practice of spiritual journaling for inner peace. Learn how to use journaling as a tool for prayer, reflection, and personal growth. We will cover different techniques and prompts to help you quiet your mind and connect with your inner self. All materials will be provided.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Wellington Lutheran Church Service, Join us for our weekly Lutheran Church service. We will celebrate the Lord's Supper, sing hymns, and hear a sermon from our pastor. This is a welcoming and traditional service for all who seek to worship God. All are welcome to attend.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Exploring The Book of Genesis, A weekly Bible study of the Book of Genesis. We will explore the stories of creation, Adam and Eve, and Noah, and discuss their theological and spiritual significance. This is a great opportunity to learn about the foundations of the Bible. All are welcome to attend.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Men's Ministry BBQ & Beer Night, A casual and fun evening for men of all ages to connect and build relationships. We'll have a BBQ dinner, craft beer tasting, and a relaxed atmosphere for conversation and fellowship. This is a great opportunity to invite friends and neighbors to connect with our men's ministry. All men are welcome to join in the fun.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Community Prayer Walk, Join us as we walk and pray for our local community. We will meet at the church and walk in a group, praying for our neighbors, our leaders, and our city. This is a peaceful and purposeful way to make a difference in the world. All are welcome to participate in this act of faith.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints - Young Single Adult Conference, A regional conference for Young Single Adults of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, providing an opportunity for spiritual growth, fellowship, and dating. The conference will include guest speakers, workshops, dances, and service projects. All young single adults are welcome to attend this inspiring and faith-building event.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Jewish Shabbat Service and Dinner, Join us for our weekly Shabbat service, a time of prayer and reflection as we welcome the Sabbath. The service will be followed by a traditional Shabbat dinner with challah, wine, and a delicious meal. This is a great opportunity to connect with the Jewish community and celebrate the Sabbath together. All are welcome to attend.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: The Book of Mormon Study Group, A weekly gathering to explore and discuss the teachings of The Book of Mormon. This is a welcoming environment for members and non-members alike to deepen their understanding of the scripture and its relevance in modern life. The sessions will involve reading passages, open discussion, and sharing personal insights. All perspectives are valued in this journey of learning and discovery.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Introduction to Sufi Meditation, An introductory workshop on Sufi meditation, the mystical path of Islam. Learn how to use breath, sound, and movement to quiet the mind and connect with the divine. This is a gentle and insightful session for those curious about contemplative spiritual traditions. No prior experience is needed, and all are welcome.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Buddhism for Beginners: The Eightfold Path, An introductory course on the core teachings of Buddhism. This workshop will provide a clear and accessible explanation of the Eightfold Path and how it can be applied to modern life to cultivate happiness and wisdom. Suitable for absolute beginners, this session is a great way to learn about the path to enlightenment.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Unitarian Universalist Community Service, Join us for our weekly Sunday service, a space for spiritual growth and community connection in a non-creedal, open-minded environment. Our services blend music, readings, and reflections from various faith traditions and sources, celebrating the diverse paths we take to find meaning. All are welcome to our inclusive and affirming space.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Christian Meditation Workshop, A workshop introducing the practice of Christian meditation. Learn how to use silent contemplation, Lectio Divina (divine reading), and centering prayer to deepen your relationship with God. This is a practical and prayerful session for anyone wanting to quiet their mind and listen for God's voice. No prior experience is needed, and all are welcome.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Spiritual Gifts Workshop, A workshop designed to help you discover and develop your spiritual gifts. Through a series of self-assessments, talks, and group activities, you will learn what your unique gifts are and how to use them to serve God and others. This is an empowering and encouraging session for all believers. All are welcome to attend.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Youth Group: Pizza and Praise Night, Calling all high school students! Join us for a fun-filled evening of pizza, games, and worship music. This youth-led event is a relaxed and friendly environment to hang out with friends, meet new people, and explore questions about faith and life. All teenagers are welcome, so bring your friends for a great night of food and fellowship.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: A Course in Miracles: Study & Discussion, A weekly study group dedicated to A Course in Miracles. Join us as we read and discuss the text, workbook, and manual for teachers. This is a space for those seeking to deepen their understanding of the Course’s teachings on forgiveness, love, and the nature of reality. All levels of experience are welcome in this supportive and collaborative environment.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Vedic Philosophy Discussion Group, A weekly meeting to delve into the ancient wisdom of Vedic philosophy. We will be studying and discussing key texts such as the Bhagavad Gita and Upanishads, exploring topics of consciousness, dharma, and the nature of the self. This group provides a space for intellectual and spiritual inquiry, and is open to all seekers of truth.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Christian Social Mixer, Come and mingle with other Christian singles, couples, and friends in a relaxed, friendly setting. This social mixer is a great opportunity to expand your network, make new friends, and build community with like-minded people who share your values. Light snacks and refreshments will be provided.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Eckankar Satsang: The Light and Sound of God, A monthly public service exploring the teachings of Eckankar. The meeting will include a brief talk on a spiritual topic, a guided contemplation on the Light and Sound of God, and a chance for attendees to share their experiences. This service offers a path for spiritual seekers to find their own truth and connect with the inner self. All are welcome.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Exploring Eastern Orthodoxy, A public lecture on the history, theology, and traditions of Eastern Orthodoxy. Learn about the unique aspects of Orthodox worship, icons, and the mystical path to union with God. This session is for anyone curious about this ancient branch of Christianity and its rich spiritual heritage.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Family Fun Day at the Church, All families are invited to join us for a day of fun and fellowship at the church. This event will include games, face painting, a bouncy castle for the kids, and a free BBQ lunch for everyone. It's a great chance to meet other families in the community and enjoy a day of outdoor activities in a safe and welcoming environment.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: The Seven Sacraments Bible Study, A study group exploring the biblical roots and theological significance of the Seven Sacraments in the Catholic Church. This course is for those seeking a deeper understanding of the sacraments as channels of grace and life in the Body of Christ. The course will be held weekly, and all are welcome to attend.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Mindful Meditation & Yoga for Stress Relief, A weekly class combining gentle yoga and guided meditation to help manage stress and promote a sense of well-being. This session focuses on the connection between mind and body, helping you to find balance and release tension. No experience is necessary, and all are welcome to attend this supportive and calming space.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Spiritual Journey to Jerusalem, An informational evening about an upcoming pilgrimage to the Holy Land. Learn about the itinerary, historical sites, and spiritual significance of visiting Jerusalem. This is a chance to ask questions, meet fellow travelers, and prepare for a life-changing journey of faith and discovery.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Jewish Spirituality: An Introduction to Kabbalah, An introductory talk on the mystical teachings of Kabbalah. Learn about the Tree of Life, the divine emanations, and the practice of meditation in Jewish mysticism. This session is designed for those curious about the esoteric dimension of Judaism and its rich spiritual tradition. All are welcome, no prior knowledge is needed.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Buddhism for Beginners: The Four Noble Truths, An introductory course on the core teachings of Buddhism. This workshop will provide a clear and accessible explanation of the Four Noble Truths and the Eightfold Path. Learn how these ancient principles can be applied to modern life to reduce suffering and cultivate happiness. Suitable for absolute beginners.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Gospel Choir Workshop, A fun and lively workshop for anyone who loves to sing gospel music. Learn harmonies, rhythms, and techniques from our experienced choir director. This is a welcoming, no-audition space for all skill levels. Join us for an evening of music, community, and joy. All voices are welcome to lift up a song of praise.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: A Night of Prayer for the City, Join us as we come together to pray for our city. This evening of corporate prayer will focus on local needs, from community welfare to political leaders, and will be an opportunity to seek God's guidance and blessing for our region. This is an interdenominational event, and all are welcome to participate.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: The Gospel According to Tolkien, A public lecture exploring the Christian themes and allegorical meanings within J.R.R. Tolkien's epic fantasy, The Lord of the Rings. Discover how his deep faith influenced his world-building, characters, and narrative arcs. This is a fascinating and insightful talk for fans of Tolkien and students of theology alike.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Spiritual Film Night: 'Samsara', A screening and discussion of the acclaimed documentary 'Samsara'. This film explores spiritual and cultural traditions from around the world, taking viewers on a visually stunning journey through life, death, and reincarnation. Following the film, there will be an open discussion to share thoughts and reflections. Snacks and drinks will be provided.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Christadelphian Bible Study: The Promises to Abraham, A weekly Bible study focusing on the promises made by God to Abraham and their significance for both the past and the future. This is a welcoming environment for anyone wanting to learn more about the Bible. The sessions are informal, with time for discussion and questions. All are welcome to attend.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Intercultural Worship Service, A special worship service celebrating the diversity of our community. This event will feature music, prayers, and readings from a variety of cultural and linguistic traditions. It's a beautiful opportunity to experience the unity of the church in a rich tapestry of worship. Everyone is welcome to join in this celebration of faith.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Beginner's Kayaking Tour on the Wairarapa Coast: A guided kayaking tour of the Wairarapa Coast, perfect for beginners. Learn basic paddling techniques and enjoy the stunning views of the coastline from the water. All equipment is provided.
label: Sports & Fitness
